info.name: sphere gears
info.description:
inspired by reference:  [url] https://twitter.com/Yugemaku/status/1571173869993750530 [/url]
mouse controls camera

renderpass.code:
#define rot(a)        mat2(cos(a+vec4(0,11,33,0)))                      // rotation 
#define d(r,n,s)      .04* sin( n *atan(r.z,r.x)+ 10.*iTime + s 1.57 )  // dents
//#define d(r,n,s)    .04* atan(3.*sin( n *atan(r.z,r.x)+ 10.*iTime + s 1.57 ))  // variant

#define half(s) r = q, \
        r.x-=.9, r.xy*=rot(.3), r.x+=.9,                     /* hemisphere */      \
        t = min(t, max( max( length(r)-1., .9-length(r)) , r.y + d(r,32.,s) )),    \
                                                   /*  max(r.y + d(r,32.,s), -r.y-.1 ))) /* variant */ \
        r.x-=.9, r.xy*=rot( -.17), r.x+=.9,              /* satellite gear */      \
        t = min(t, max( length(r.yz)-.28 -d(r.yxz,12.,s), abs(r.x+.95) -.03 ) ) 


void mainImage(out vec4 O, vec2 U)
{
    float t=9.;
    vec3  R = iResolution,
          D = normalize(vec3(U+U, -12.*R.y) - R),          // ray direction
          p = vec3(0,0,20), q, r,                          // marching point along ray 
          M = iMouse.z > 0. ? iMouse.xyz/R -.5
              :  vec3( .15,.07,0) * cos(.3*iTime + vec3(0,11,0)); 
    p += sqrt(R.y/18.) * texelFetch(iChannel0,ivec2(U)%1024,0).x * D; // jitter against pseudo-shading banding
          
    for (O=vec4(1); O.x > 0. && t > .01; O-=.01)           // march scene
        q = p,
        q.yz *= rot(-6.*M.y),                              // rotations
        q.xz *= rot(-6.*M.x-1.57), 
        t = 9., half(), q.y = -q.y, half(-),               // full 3D shape,
 
        p += .5*t*D;                                       // step forward = dist to obj          

   O *= O * 1.3;                                           // color scheme
}
renderpass.name: Image
